ticket.title: [PATCH] multibyte_chars_test.rb failing tests
ticket.original-body:

version.title: [PATCH] multibyte_chars_test.rb failing tests

version.body: Please close that is now commited
version.title: [PATCH] multibyte_chars_test.rb failing tests

version.body:
Changing the examples made the tests run, but now they're not correct anymore. Consider the rjust failure and look at it with ASCII characters.
@@@ > '1111'.rjust(7, 'a') => "aaa1111" @@@
In the test UNICODE_STRING is 4 characters long, so the following assertion is correct.
@@@ assert_equal "ααα#{UNICODE_STRING}", @chars.rjust(7, 'α') @@@
version.body-html:
Changing the examples made the tests run, but now they're not correct anymore. Consider the rjust failure and look at it with ASCII characters.

> '1111'.rjust(7, 'a')
=> "aaa1111"

In the test UNICODE_STRING is 4 characters long, so the following assertion is correct.

assert_equal "ααα#{UNICODE_STRING}", @chars.rjust(7, 'α')
version.title: [PATCH] multibyte_chars_test.rb failing tests

version.body: So looks like it need to be revert? hmm ..
version.body-html: So looks like it need to be revert? hmm ..
version.title: [PATCH] multibyte_chars_test.rb failing tests

version.body:
Yes, please revert, this appears to be a bug in 1.9.1p376. Note that on 1.9 rjust, ljust, and center are directly forwarded to String.
The tests run fine on:
@@@ ruby 1.8.7 (2008-08-11 patchlevel 72) [universal-darwin10.0] ruby 1.9.1p243 (2009-07-16 revision 24175) [i386-darwin10.2.0] ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-02-02 trunk 26254) [x86_64-darwin10.2.0] @@@
version.body-html:
Yes, please revert, this appears to be a bug in 1.9.1p376. Note that on 1.9 rjust, ljust, and center are directly forwarded to String.

The tests run fine on:

ruby 1.8.7 (2008-08-11 patchlevel 72) [universal-darwin10.0]
ruby 1.9.1p243 (2009-07-16 revision 24175) [i386-darwin10.2.0]
ruby 1.9.2dev (2010-02-02 trunk 26254) [x86_64-darwin10.2.0]
version.title: [PATCH] multibyte_chars_test.rb failing tests

version.body: I've also submitted a bug report to the Ruby tracker: http://redmine.ruby-lang.org/issues/show/2705. I would advise against using p376 right now if you're using rjust, ljust, or center in your code.
version.body-html: I've also submitted a bug report to the Ruby tracker: http://redmine.ruby-lang.org/issues/show/2705. I would advise against using p376 right now if you're using rjust, ljust, or center in your code.
version.title: [PATCH] multibyte_chars_test.rb failing tests

version.body: Yes you're right Manfred, my bad :). Here is the revert patch.
version.body-html:
Yes you're right Manfred, my bad :).
Here is the revert patch.
version.title: [PATCH] multibyte_chars_test.rb failing tests
